summary: This is the verdict sheet from the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York. It lists six counts against her, including conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and sex trafficking related to minors, and provides checkboxes for the jury's guilty or not guilty verdicts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant on trial, facing six criminal counts related to conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and sex trafficking of minors.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The presiding judge for the case, identified as 'HONORABLE ALISON J. NATHAN' on the verdict sheet.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Verdict
events.description: The jury is presented with a verdict sheet to record their decisions on six criminal counts against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with six criminal counts, including conspiracy and substantive acts related to sex trafficking and illegal sexual activity with minors.
The charges specifically reference 'Minor Victim-1' in Counts Two and Four, and 'Minor Victim-4' in Count Six.
The document is a formal verdict sheet for the jury to record their findings on each count.
